text:
Hazem Harb is a Palestinian visual artist currently based out of Dubai, UAE. Hazem Harb is better known for his visual works including "The Invisible Landscape and Concrete Futures". In 2008, Hazem was nominated for The Young Artist of the Year Award by the A. M. Qattan Foundation.
Career.
In 1980, Hazem Harb was born in Gaza, Palestine. In 2004, he migrated to Italy and enrolled himself in the Academy of Fine Art in Rome. In 2009, he obtained his MFA degree from The European Institute of Design, Rome, Italy. In 2011, Hazem was granted the second residency at The Delfina Foundation, London. Notably, in 2015, he exhibited "The Invisible Landscape & Concrete Futures" at Salsali Private Museum in Dubai, which was well-received by critics.
